abstract.p: Philippe Starck designs interior of Katsuya restaurant in Los Angeles; photos (S)

block.p: Katsuya, a Japanese restaurant, will open on June 26 in the Brentwood area of Los Angeles, a project of the designer Philippe Starck, above on left, and the SBE Restaurant Group. It will be the first in a series of restaurants and hotels the restaurant group plans to build with Mr. Starck, said the restaurant group's chief executive, Sam Nazarian, above on right.
Named for its chef, Katsuya Uechi, the restaurant has hemlock walls and ceilings and a shape suggesting a bento box.

Katsuya, a Japanese restaurant, will open on June 26 in the Brentwood area of Los Angeles, a project of the designer Philippe Starck, above on left, and the SBE Restaurant Group. It will be the first in a series of restaurants and hotels the restaurant group plans to build with Mr. Starck, said the restaurant group's chief executive, Sam Nazarian, above on right.
Named for its chef, Katsuya Uechi, the restaurant has hemlock walls and ceilings and a shape suggesting a bento box.

The peripatetic Mr. Starck, speaking from Paris, said the design keeps the focus on Mr. Uechi and his food. ''It's a man, the guy, the chef. We try to make as little as possible around him,'' he said. At center is a square robata grill. ''It's so pure, so elegant,'' Mr. Starck said. ''We have made, in a way, a temple.''

A mural-size photograph of a woman's lips hangs over one table in the dining room, a close-up of a hand decorates one of two sushi bars, top right, and a tattoo dominates a lounge area, above left. The details are a symbol of humanity, Mr. Starck said. Other images appear in the restroom mirrors when the water is on.
Katsuya is at 11777 San Vicente Boulevard, (310) 207-8744.
